title: Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story
descriptions:
"Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story" is a biographical television film released in 2009 that chronicles the life of Dr. Ben Carson, who rose from a poor, inner-city background to become a world-renowned neurosurgeon. Directed by Thomas Carter, the film stars Cuba Gooding Jr. as Carson and is based on Carson's autobiography, "Gifted Hands."

The film begins by showing Ben as a young boy (played by Jaishon Fisher) growing up in Detroit, Michigan. Despite his academic struggles and low self-esteem, his mother Sonya Carson (played by Kimberly Elise), who has only a third-grade education and is working multiple jobs to support her family after her husband left, never gives up on him. She encourages Ben and his brother Curtis to read and learn, instilling in them the value of education and hard work.

Sonya limits her sons' television watching and requires them to read two books a week and write book reports, even though she can barely read herself. This regimen leads to a remarkable turnaround in Ben's academic performance. As Ben (now portrayed by Cuba Gooding Jr.) progresses through high school, he discovers his love for science and decides to pursue a medical career.

The film then follows Carson's journey through college at Yale University, where he encounters challenges but excels academically, and later at the University of Michigan Medical School. Despite facing racism and self-doubt, Carson's determination and intelligence help him overcome these obstacles. His dedication and skill eventually lead him to Johns Hopkins University Medical Center, where he becomes the director of pediatric neurosurgery at the age of 33.

One of the key moments in the film is the depiction of the groundbreaking surgery Carson led in 1987, where he successfully separated conjoined twins who were connected at the back of the headâ€”a procedure that had never been successfully performed before. This operation brings Dr. Carson international acclaim and cements his reputation as an outstanding surgeon.

Throughout the film, Carson's character is shown not only as a gifted surgeon but also as a compassionate individual who is deeply connected to his patients and their families. His personal philosophies, faith, and the support from his wife, Candy (played by Aunjanue Ellis), play significant roles in his life and career.

"Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story" is an inspirational tale that showcases how determination, hard work, and a belief in oneself can lead to extraordinary achievements. It emphasizes the importance of a supportive family and the impact that a strong, positive role model can have on a child's development. The film aims to inspire viewers to overcome their circumstances and strive for excellence in their chosen fields.
